name: primitively
content:
primitively adverb
(BASIC)
Add to word list
Add to word list
usually disapproving in a way that is basic, unpleasant, or uncomfortable : By modern standards the house was built primitively, out of great blocks of stone. The band headed to a primitively equipped studio and recorded the album in a week.

primitively adverb
(EARLY)
in a way that is typical of an early stage of development of a society or an organism : The area's first inhabitants lived primitively and spent a large part of their time hunting. The lower jaw has anatomical features that are both primitively ancient and more modern. It's a primitively wingless insect with a long tail segment.
